Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds outweigh smaller issues.”
Reviews.Author: Jster
Reviews.Content: Most hotel beds are hard and uncomfortable. The Hotel Highland has soft beds that are hands-down the best hotel mattresses I've found in a long time. The rooms are a bit small, but are decorated nicely and laid out well, negating the size a bit. The flat-screen TV makes a big difference. There were a few small problems with our stay, though. The cleaning staff needs to learn that bleach will get rid of mildew on shower tile grout. The sink faucet was plumbed backwards - moving the lever to the left should make the water warmer, not the right. There is a cubbyhole for the iron right above the luggage stand; From the look of the bottom corner, I'm not the only person to hit my head on it when getting something from my suitcase. A list of TV channels would be good, as would a list of services. The breakfast food was nice, but the lounge area is not the place to eat it. If you can, take your food to the patio where there are real tables. The lounge/restaurant has a couch-seating type arrangement, so familes need to stay away unless your kids are really good at balancing plates on their knees. It may be trendy, but nobody's buying - the lounge was completely empty at 10 pm on a Saturday night. We stayed on the front-desk floor and although there is an alcove for an ice machine, it was empty. Hotels need ice machines, especially when the fridge in the room doesn't have a freezer section. If you can overlook the smaller problems in favor of mattress comfort, this is THE place in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “One of 2 NON-chain hotels in PHX and the hands down winner.”
Reviews.Author: Sb360
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious, touch of luxury, lovely inside and out, and a decent if not good breakfast. I do reviews and even had to stay at the other boutique hotel for free and still left early to come here. Staff is lovely and local, outdoor pool is clean and nice with a fireplace and great atmosphere. Internet is slow but the parking is ample and right there, the shower, rooms, beds and pillows are great, and the prices are fantastic for the location and the building. Unassuming from the outside, lovely on the inside. Thank you. I will be back as will our business.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Hotel Highland”
Reviews.Author: Jane S
Reviews.Content: From the outside, I didn't expect it to be anything special. A friend had booked the reservation, and we were delighted to find a clean and spacious room with great bedding and pillows, an outside fireplace (where we played scrabble at night), a clean and comfortable hot tub, a hot breakfast with good variety and pleasant kitchen staff, a nice happy hour and, in general, a safe and welcoming experience with excellent staff. Don't pass this one up. This will be my first choice on all future visits to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as pictured on their website”
Reviews.Author: siscoziger
Reviews.Content: You never know with websites anymore- are their photos current or were they taken years ago or do few rooms actually look that good... Our room was beautiful; exactly as advertised. The bathroom was tiny but we are large people so many may not mind that at all. The shower stall was so thin my husband felt like the hulk with his shoulders touching both walls. Decor was very nice. No room service and the lounge(despite advertising) was not really set up to have a real meal (no tables just bar seating.) Lots of restaurants close by but we had SiuWok deliver to the room. AC was freezing which is good for AZ even in March. Could have used more towels an extra pillow and blanket and a directory of services in the room. Wifi seemed slow had to use 3G to write this. Friendly staff, looked like a nice pool, plenty of parking, no ice machines tho or none we could find. Great room for around $100.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel with PHENOMINAL beds”
Reviews.Author: TheParrothead
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for Spring Training in 2012. It met our needs well, but didn't excel in much of anything. Except, of course for the FANTASTIC beds. I am very particular about beds, and have traveled pretty regularly. I've tried a few hundred different beds. This one is by far one of the top three. Ever. Including my own at home. The walls were thin and the hallways were loud. You could literally walk down the hallway and hear peoples conversations in their rooms without even trying. The doors were heavy and incredibly loud when they closed. Anytime one of the doors on my floor closed, I woke up. If you are a light sleeper like me, you will need earplugs. The bathroom was small, and the shower was barely warm enough to call hot. Could have used another degree or two. The water tasted terrible, a lot like soap, in fact. It's not their fault, as anyone there is subject to the water supplied by the city. But bring extra drinking water. The nice thing is that the hotel provides strawberry water downstairs that was delicious. But the glasses are small, and it would be awkward to bring your water bottle down to fill up. There was a nice gym with a decent array of equipment. Not world-class, but enough to work out the majors. The breakfast was pretty good, and there was plenty of it. Seating is a little odd, mostly conversational couches, but it worked. There might be a nightly reception in the same area, but we were never around during that time of day. Delightful pool area with a fire pit for nighttime gathering. Though the pool was mighty cold, even for the most young at heart. The hot tub was nice with plenty of room. Don't think I'd stay here again. Even with one of the best beds ever. There are just to many good options in town

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: MuchofrioenSD
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Highland was a great find! We were looking for a hotel near the Biltmore Fashion park-and this turned out to be perfect! The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms and common areas were clean and updated, and the bed was super comfy! The breakfast in the morning was quick and easy-and they had a nice variety to choose from. There is a lot to do in the area within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights last spring and loved this hotel. It was so nice to relax and enjoy breakfast and dinner on the patio area. My room was very clean and comfortable and the service from each employee I encountered was superb. I will definitely return to this hotel when I'm back in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Small and upscale”
Reviews.Author: ladipierce
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in. It looked like it had just been refurbished. All of the furniture, wall coverings and floor coverings looked fairly new. Very clean. Small and intimate. The room had a queen bed, 2 club chairs and a large ottoman that the 2 chairs shared. Also a desk and desk chair and a microwave and small refridgerator hidden away in the credenza. Over the credenza, a 25 inch TV. A little small for the room, but still OK. Our room had a tub and a great rain showerhead. The room had a 2 cup serving coffee pot, but we didn't really need it with the lounge down the hall on the first floor and the full breakfast in the a.m. Everything was clean, modern (I call it IKEA style dark furniture) and well placed. The staff was VERY friendly, letting us come a little early and leave 45 minutes after the official check-out without charging extra. They have an airport shuttle that I believe would also take you to some local spots if desired and the driver gave us excellent directions to the airport since we had a rental car. The pool and spa were glass enclosed with plenty of lounges. Outside of the pool area there were tables with umbrellas and chairs. Also a gas fire pit was blazing in the evening. The full breakfast was in the lounge which has couches and coffee tables or tall bar stools at 2 bar areas. The breakfast had almost everything although it was all pre-packaged food, nothing made on the premises. The only negative, other than the pre-prepared food was that the food was not terrifically hot. Although we we there 30 minutes after the buffet opened, could be the warming trays hadn't heated up sufficiently yet. 10 minutes from the airport. We will definitely stay there again if we can.

Reviews.Title: “charged my bank after i had cancelled a reservation!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sharon b
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a stay at this hotel for check in on feb 18th for 3 nights. I ended up cancelling the reservation on Feb 4th and received a confirmation number. The hotel billed my credit card for one night stay on feb 21! I got in touch with the hotel as soon as I saw the charge and they admitted I never should have been charged however I still have yet to see a credit to my bank account!

Reviews.Title: “not a big hotel but way better than my 5-star Vegas hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: J L
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and efficient. We always had our traveler's questions answered with a smile and patience. Their continental breakfast serves hot and cold with many varieties to choose from in a modern, yet comfy restaurant setting room. I was late for breakfast one day, the staff was nice enough to take out food from the kitchen for me to choose. The room was clean and spacious. It may not be a big 5-star but we really enjoy this place where everybody knows your name! We are for sure going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Anna M
Reviews.Content: My stay was more than I expected. The room was great, very large with a very comfy king size bed, desk and sitting area, the staff was very nice and the breakfast had many things to choose from, it also included Starbucks coffee and many varieties of tea. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “No room safes!”
Reviews.Author: travelbuga
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated but in great need of refurbishing. The rooms do not have security safe and I had some items of great value (sentimental!) stolen from my room. The hotel did nothing to help me locate my items. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Italian-in-usa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is super clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and efficient. Kevin, the GM, was extremely helpful this morning when I was trying to extend my stay by one night. He accommodated my request quickly and made it simple. The breakfast is excellent quality and everything looks fresh. The equipment in the fitness room is very modern. The location is perfect and I will come back here with the family next time I visit Phoenix. Thank you Kevin and all your staff!

Reviews.Title: “surprise surprise --- friendly service, luxurious rooms, poolside firepit”
Reviews.Author: adtripvizor
Reviews.Content: Took a chance staying here and so glad I tried it. This hotel is in a great Phoenix location in the Biltmore corridor with easy access to the sights. It looks basic from a distance, but the closer you look the better it gets. The huge rooms are comfortable and well furnished. The front desk team is very welcoming and there's a great lobby bar with a poolside fire pit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Neat Rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jaishn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on our trip to Sedona. The location was fantastic – close to freeways, shops, restaurants and even some 24 hour grocery stores. The room was remodeled, clean and serviced frequently This is one of the good breakfast deals I have seen with quite a variety of food available. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: wjack
Reviews.Content: I tried this hotel based mostly on the recommendations on this website. The hotel has a very convenient location. The staff were all very friendly and the service was also very good. There was always someone cleaning something. Their rates are very reasonable for the area (Arizona Biltmore and Ritz Carlton are neighbors). The rooms are spacious and clean. One minor complaint is that there is insufficent storage space-limited drawers and a very small closet. The pool area is nice and usually very quiet. The breakfast buffet is nothing special, but adaquate. The beds were very comfortable as were the pillows. All in all, a good choice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel; would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: TheBallards
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night here when driving from Las Vegas to Tucson; the rooms was lovely, cool (it was 100 degrees outside!) clean, modern and a good size; bed was very comfy. Staff were friendly, breakfast excellent considering it was complimentary. Although it is quiet where the hotel is there is an upscale mall just around the corner (5mins walk) where there are some nice restaurants. We ate at the "Cheesecake Factory"; not just cheesecakes! We got there for happy hour and had great half price appetisers and wine. Then a main meal. The food was really excellent, the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Plus”
Reviews.Author: Leslie S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Highland for a weekend as we were seeing a concert nearby. Our king room was huge with a very nice sitting area. The room had many amenities including a flat screen t.v., refrigerator and a microwave. However, the best part was the staff. Everyone we met was friendly and helpful. Forgot our corkscrew? No problem... the bartender opened the bottle no charge and even loaned me a nice wine glass. Can't find the ice machine? No worries... the maintenance gentleman saw me wandering around with the bucket and took it into the kitchen to fill it. The maids brought extra pillows and towels. My husband and I have already marked The Hotel Highland as our new favorite hotel in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Luxury”
Reviews.Author: nplittlestone
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Highland at Biltmore may be a little out of the way, but not much. We stayed there on the last night of our Grand Canyon trip. The outside of the hotel isn't much to look at, but the first view of our room solicited a "Wow!" The rectangular space featured two Queen beds, a table and chair, a lounge chair, and a lengthy gorgeous granite sink with baskets for towels. Note that there was plenty of room on that sink for two toilet kits and towles and amenities. And the shower had a square rain showerhead with great pressure. Lest I forget, the beds were fantastic. Soft enough that I didn't need my sleeping pad. On top of all that, we got a free breakfast the next morning. Not just pastry and coffee but a full buffet with juice, cereal, pastries, breads, omelet, sausage, and potatoes. Everything for just $95 a night. The hotel is about 12 minutes from the airport and about 20 minutes from Scottsdale. The area was quiet, the hotel was quiet. In fact, we wondered why more people weren't staying there. Would I stay there again? You betcha.

Reviews.Title: “It felt like home, clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Charhs
Reviews.Content: The room sizes are very generous, lots of space to relax. Everything was very clean and well taken care of. Breakfast was great, with a good variety. We Loved the firepit and the easy access to shopping and restaurants. The free shuttle and the staff are the best.

Reviews.Title: “So so...”
Reviews.Author: BonnieAha
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Highland is o.k., but just o.k. The price was decent, the room fairly clean and fairly large. The service was very spotty. There didn't seem to be much staff available and, although they were polite, they didn't seem to be very efficient. Every day I had to chase down a staff member for coffee for the coffee maker in the room. The free shuttle to the airport was very helpful. This is not a bad place to stay, as long as you are looking for a decent room at a good price in a nice section of Phoenix...just don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again any time”
Reviews.Author: aray213
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights and couldnt be any happier for the money spent. The hotel is within walking distance of many great restaurants and shopping choices. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very well appointed. The Breakfast buffet was more than expected and a pleasent surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Huge "Bang for Your Buck"”
Reviews.Author: LA_via_Europe
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful surprise. Top notch smaller hotel with very friendly staff, super comfy beds, and extremely friendly and accommodating staff! Rooms are very quiet, parking is a breeze. Front desk folks are very gracious and will help out with anything. Nice wine/beer bar with Italian/French type sandwiches and snacks. Awesome, spotless and refreshing swimming pool. I stayed here during a business trip in June 2011. I have only been to Phoenix a couple of times before and didn't know what to expect. My business partners booked this hotel for us and it turned out perfect. Close enough to the airport but in a pleasant neighbourhood, with some cool dining options within a 5-10 min walk - a funky sushi place, Ruth's Chris, and an outstanding Greek restaurant, all very tasty and affordable. The hotel itself has an awesome breakfast spread! Not the usual stale bagels and Dannon yougurt but fresh juices, a myriad of teas, delicious hot and cold breakfast items. I generally stick to a yogourt at these breakfast buffets but this again was another wow-surprise! As far as I recall and was reminded of again this trip, Phoenix is sprawl, sprawl, sprawl, much like LA where I live. If you're here on business and you know the vicinity is close, I can't recommend this hotel more. Oh, and we ended up staying an extra day for which we had to pay out of pocket. It was something like $80. A hotel like this in LA would easily cost $250. Very highly recommended - just make sure the location is convenient for you.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: sgautrea
Reviews.Content: We were treated very well. I really liked the fitness room and the breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: travellerdnc0910
Reviews.Content: Very clean, spacious rooms. Beautiful lobby with fruit and water, nice breakfast. Will stay again when in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for the area!”
Reviews.Author: BruinDan
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore area of Phoenix is a very upscale section of the city where accommodations (at the likes of the Ritz Carlton, Arizona Biltmore Resort and Embassy Suites) can get more than a little pricey. Thankfully, the Hotel Highland at Biltmore is a reasonably priced option, costing around half the nightly rate of other hotels. Located slightly off the main drag, the Highland is a quiet property that is about a 10-minute walk to the shopping and restaurants of either the Biltmore Fashion Park or the Esplanade Center. There’s no formal restaurant on-site, but there is a wine and beer lounge in the evening where you can get a light meal. My check-in and check-out were pleasant and efficient. My room was clean and spacious, and featured a flat screen TV, iPod dock, mini-refrigerator, complimentary Wi-Fi, large marble vanity outside the bathroom, and a very cozy bed. The complimentary breakfast was served in a comfortable lounge, and (in addition to the standard continental fare) featured pre-made omelets, bacon, fruit salad, hard boiled eggs and a variety of yogurts. You might sacrifice a little convenience by staying here, but if you’re a business traveler, the Highland is a comfortable alternative that won’t devour your per diem.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and great location in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: JayT1021
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night before flying home from Phoenix. I was extremely happy with my stay here. The staff was very friendly. Every person I encountered, wether they worked at the front desk or were cleaning or restaurant staff, gave me a genuine friendly greeting. The hotel itself was updated a couple of years ago. The decor was trendy and the entire place looked very clean. My room was large and nicely appointed. It seems to me that a lot of care has gone into every aspect of decorating this hotel. The hotel is in a great location. It's just around the corner from and upscale mall and the Ritz Carlton. The breakfast included was the best that I had of all five hotels I stayed in during this trip. Best of all I payed under $100 dollars (before tax) for my room and I felt like I had an experience worth much more. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: haldane42
Reviews.Content: The outside is not that impressive, but the room we had was spacious, clean and really very pretty. Especially for the price! The staff needed a little more sprucing up, but the rooms were great! Just ask for the down pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bonlou30
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. I chose this hotel because it had an airport shuttle and was close to the shops and restaurants at Biltmore Park. It was so much more: beautiful spacious rooms, amazing staff members who went above and beyond, a fire pit at night, complimentary hors d'oeuvres, the list goes on. We had stayed at many hotels and resorts in Phoenix/Scottsdale but this is where we want to stay on our return.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable nothing breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: rayandgabby
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice, comfortable beds, nice flat screen tv, spacious bathroom and room overall. The area and hotel itself is well maintained and very clean. There is a pool and jacuzzi with a very pretty patio that has an outdoor fireplace. They have a full bar available and offer free breakfast, but I was not impressed with breakfast. They had a few options but nothing too good, on our last day they actually started cleaning out the food area before 10 am when breakfast is 7 to 10. A couple of other things that bugged me were that the room did not have the hotel information such as how to access the internet or pool hours, I had to call and find out. The next is, when our room was cleaned we didnt get more body soap, shampoo, or lotion. I would reccomend it, we got a deal on it so it was worth the $ but I would not pay the 150 regular price per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, so-so service, weak internet...”
Reviews.Author: RockiesExpert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Highland last week for four nights while going to spring training baseball games. They had a great promotion going, and it seems that many baseball fans were staying there because of it. This is not the first time we have stayed here, having been guests of this property both when it switched to the Highland ownership a couple years ago and when it was a Phoenix Inn and Suites property. We just love the location, near the Biltmore Fashion Square mall and all the shopping and restaurants you could ask for, all within a 10 minute walk. Freeway access to all parts of the Valley of the Sun is easy, and this is a big advantage if you have many different destinations to go to within the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. The rooms are nicely appointed, with a boutique hotel feel. Flat panel TV is mounted on the wall. The beds are very comfortable, and good sheets and linens are used in the rooms. Beware, though, that some rooms are in a noisier location than others. Our first room assignment was right across from the elevator, and boisterous baseball fans could be heard talking and laughing as they waited for the slow elevator to arrive. This brings me to the main issue we had with the hotel. On our first night, we called to the front desk about the noise, and the clerk told us that they could move us to one of two rooms down the hall, away from the elevator, the next day since people were checking out. She put in our request, and said we would be given one of the rooms after checkout and housekeeping was done. Then, late the next morning, we got another call from the front desk from a different clerk, telling us that unfortunately we could not be moved since the hotel is sold out,.even though these rooms were vacated and we had our request in. It's not like we were asking for an extra room, I told her, since we'd be leaving our current room. Then, the clerk said that would cause extra housekeeping work. Huh? Weren't they going to clean up our room anyway during the day? This was quite frustrating, so we asked to speak to the on-duty manager. She was very nice and understanding, saying the front desk may have some training issues. Both rooms we requested, by the way, had already been cleaned as we saw the housekeepr in them, so they were available for immediate move-in. The manager delayed our move, though, saying that they needed inspection first before we'd be given the key to move down the hall. This took an extra 45 minutes, but we finally moved. All in all, this was a hassle that didn't need to happen, but we were glad with the outcome as our new room was quiet, bigger (a corner room at the end of the hall), and we were fine for the rest of our stay. The wireless internet would be my only other problem. It was either extremely slow or completely unavailable. They told us a new T-1 line was about to be installed in the next week, so this weakness may be solved by the time you want to stay here. The breakfast room was packed every morning with the baseball crowd, and it was hard to find a seat to eat. Food was standard fare for a 3-star type of hotel, with some warm items such as flat sausage and eggs, to go along with a good variety of cereals, breads and bagels. The elevator, as I mentioned earlier, is slow. But we stayed on the top (4th) floor, so we noticed it more. We just used the stairwell near our room to go down every time instead of taking the elevator. It was that slow. In summary, this is a good boutique hotel choice at a reasonable price if done on a promotion, and in a great part of town. Beware of inexperienced or poorly trained front desk staff there, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury at super price”
Reviews.Author: jponsford
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Highland while attending the Heard Museum Native Arts show and were very pleased. The hotel is modern and super clean with a really cool rain like shower and those cool modern sinks were the water comes out like a waterfall, flat screen TV and down comforter on the bed was super comfy. The comlimentary breakfast was the best. Omeletes, potatoes, sausages, many types of juice, Starbucks coffee and different cereals. Walking distance to this really nice upscale Mall and the Ceese Cake Factory! I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: tmstewar2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 1 night during a business trip I had to the area. Overall the hotel was well maintained. The room was large and roomy (403), flat screen TV, very modern features. There is only a shower no tub not a big deal to us. Only 1 elevator and small so it was cramped at times. My husband stays in hotels 3-4 per week and stated this was the best free breakfast he has ever had. The breakfast bar had tamales, pita sandwhichs, fruit, cereal, bread, oatmeal and free starbucks coffee. If you are looking for a smaller hotel with free parking, convienent to the area, large modern rooms I don't think you can go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Service is poor but great location”
Reviews.Author: lgt565
Reviews.Content: I wanted to look for another hotel that i could frequent during the week so i tried HH out for a weekend getaway. Location and rooms are great for the value. You're definitley not paying for service so dont have high expectations there. Management is nonexistent. I emailed the General Manager and front office manager regarding my stay and still have never heard a word. One, the special rate of $89 is not really available nor are their packages on the site. They say $89 and when you book the rate turns to$199. The first line on their site states a business center. Front desk told me they don't have one anymore. My luck no airport shuttle that day either - the shuttle person called off work. Oh, then after a 7 mile hike, starving, i was told i was out of luck again. The cook also called off work and there would be no food served.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: barista516
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight for a wedding and booked a jacuzzi suite with romance package. The room was great, with the tub right in the corner, a nice king bed, and an adequate sitting area/desk as well (who needs an armchair when you have a jacuzzi tub!) Room was clean, we grabbed a late night sandwich from @lynked, a great lounge with potential! Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast in the morning, well stocked and varied for being included with the room. While we didn't receive all the perks of our romance package that stay, a quick reply mentioning this in a survey request from the hotel righted things. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, outstanding hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Momtwokids
Reviews.Content: Our entire family had gone down to Phoenix for a funeral and we all stayed at this hotel. They were so attentive to our needs. And the rooms were spectacular. Clean and beautifully decorated. The outdoor pool was also lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CalmandFlexible
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to many places. Rooms were larger than I expected and nicer. There is a nice sitting area about 10 feet from bed. Only complaint was the sink wasn't inside the bathroom (So when one of us was up early, so was the other). Average Pool. Great breakfast included with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: trvlr2009
Reviews.Content: I took a chance as I remembered this hotel before when it was the Phoenix Inn and it was questionable at best but we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were very nice and clean. The employees were polite and friendly. I was a bit concerned when our room was adjacent to the road but once the shades were drawn the room was completely darkened and we could hear no street noise. The bed was comfortable and although the sink was outside of the actual bathroom it was fine and worked well for us. The breakfast was typical of breakfasts supplied by hotels, cereal, bagels, toast, english muffins, toaster waffles, one selection each day of a hot item, yogurt, fruit, coffee and tea. Although we didn't use the pool it looked clean and nice, we did use the hot tub which was great after a long day. Overall we were extremely satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could not believe the value for money!”
Reviews.Author: 1950marie
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we booked through "getaroom.com", so we were apprehensive about quality - TOTALLY and pleasantly surprised. The hotel has been renovated - rooms are spacious, excellent bedding, included fridge and microwave very discreetly stored in the room. It had everything we wanted and then some. It compared very favourably with our hotel of choice - the Hilton family. You can't lose on value for money or comfort level. Staff were great, outdoor heated pool and hot tub were well maintained, breakfast was reasonable. The only thing I could complain about was the coffee in the room was not as strong as we prefer but the free breakfast buffet more than made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment at the Highland”
Reviews.Author: Highwaydude
Reviews.Content: After researching Hotels in this area, I thought I would give the Hotel Highland a chance. So I talked a group of friends, who were all coming into town for an event to also stay at the Hotel Highland. Even before getting to the hotel, my expectations were heading downward. As with traveling in winter, mother nature sometimes does not cooperate. So due to a winter storm, one of my friends was not able to make it to Phoenix and had to call the hotel to cancel his reservation. But Hotel Highland doesn't care what mother nature throws you, instead they changed a full night to my friends credit card for having to cancel his trip. Lets not forget it was me who talked everyone into staying here and we had 3 more rooms booked. After talking with the Manager at check it, it is their policy and they stick to it! If it had not been for one of my friends reserving it thru a 3rd party website, I would of been moving all my friends to another hotel the next day. I might also want to add that when I decided to book at this hotel, I had emailed the email provided on the website to get the special online offer they were advertising. Two weeks went by and I had never received a response. So I called the hotel up and asked to make a reservation. I mentioned I wanted the special rate that was advertised on their website for $89/night. I was informed their was no special and that rate shouldn't be on their webpage, but clearly my internet browser does not lie. So after some discussion over the phone I was finally given the $89/night. Clearly someone needs to be returning emails to their customers and know what they are advertising on their website. To the room I go, which not to my liking I'm put on the first floor. I reserved a one bedroom king and since this hotel seems fairly refreshed, everything was pretty new. As I did like the overall decor of the rooms, I found it very odd having the bathroom sink right in the open of the room. Since it was just me I had no problem, but if guests had more then one person in the room. This would get odd when one is sleeping and others want to get up to use the sink and wake everyone. My friend thou informed me the rooms upstairs have the sinks in the bathrooms, so this may be just a first floor issue. A few small complaints in the room. The TV does not swivel. At the base of the sink post was long human hair, which should of been easily cleaned, and while in the bathroom I noticed very small black bugs crawling around the base tile boards at times. Overall, I suppose if the trip didn't start off on such a bad note, my stay here would of been better. But just take note, this hotel does not care of mother nature throws at you. Be ready to be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MLJohnson
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. We got a great rate! Great location, you can walk to restaurants and shopping; appreciated the complimentary airport shuttle which was convenient; the continental breakfast was marginal; the rooms had been updated and were very nice; soft and plush towels, free wifi, flat screen tv. The bed for me, was too soft, but I tend to like a firm mattress. If you like a soft mattress you will love it. I also didn't like the vanity/sink being in the room, not the bathroom, but not a big deal. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They have a small fitness room and an outdoor pool. Free parking. We would stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Highland at Biltmore
HotelInfo.Address: 2310 E. Highland Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85016 (Formerly Phoenix Inn Suites)
